predictions.text: The U.S. will enact (bill signed into law) a federal extension of current Medicare telehealth flexibilities (including coverage for telehealth provided to patients in their homes and continuation of key COVID-era waivers) that prevents a lapse and extends these flexibilities through at least 2026-12-31, by 2026-03-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A bill becomes public law (Congress.gov status 'Became Law' and/or White House statement) explicitly extending Medicare telehealth flexibilities through a date on/after 2026-12-31.
evidence: MarketWatch reports imminent risk that up to 67 million Americans could lose telehealth coverage without congressional funding: https://www.marketwatch.com/story/67-million-americans-could-lose-telehealth-coverage-in-the-coming-days-unless-congress-approves-funding-5693cf1d
monitoring_signals: House Ways & Means / Senate Finance markup or unanimous-consent requests on telehealth extenders
CMS statements on telehealth waiver end-dates
Congressional leadership announcements tying telehealth to must-pass vehicles (funding/tax/health packages)
predictions.rationale: Telehealth extenders have repeatedly been renewed in bipartisan packages; the near-term disruption risk increases the odds of a short-fuse legislative fix.

predictions.text: The U.S. will announce and implement (via presidential proclamation, USTR notice, Federal Register, and/or CBP guidance) new or increased import tariffs on goods of Canadian origin with an incremental increase of at least +25 percentage points for at least one clearly defined product category (HS chapter or narrower), by 2026-05-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Official U.S. action documents show an implemented tariff-rate increase of ≥25 percentage points applied to at least one Canadian-origin product category, with effective date on/before 2026-05-31.
evidence: CNBC notes Trump threatening Canada with sweeping tariffs, including 100% if it deepens China ties: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/24/trump-tariff-canada-china.html
monitoring_signals: USTR/White House statements on Canada trade actions
Federal Register notices referencing Canada tariff changes
CBP CSMS messages updating duty rates for Canadian-origin goods
predictions.rationale: Public tariff threats increase tail risk, but translating threats into implemented, category-specific tariff schedules is less certain.

predictions.text: The Government of Canada will publish and begin applying retaliatory trade measures against the United States (e.g., surtaxes/retaliatory tariffs) covering U.S.-origin goods with a stated annual import coverage of at least CAD 5 billion (or equivalent stated coverage), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A Government of Canada order/notice (e.g., Canada Gazette, Department of Finance or Global Affairs Canada release) announces and makes effective retaliatory tariffs/surtaxes on U.S.-origin goods with stated coverage ≥ CAD 5B annually (or equivalent).
evidence: CNBC highlights increased U.S.-Canada tariff threats and trade uncertainty: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/24/trump-tariff-canada-china.html
monitoring_signals: Finance Canada and Global Affairs Canada trade remedy announcements
Canada Gazette publications mentioning surtaxes on U.S. goods
Canadian industry consultations on retaliation lists
predictions.rationale: Retaliation is plausible if U.S. tariffs materialize, but magnitude and timing depend on whether and how U.S. measures are implemented.

predictions.text: ENISA or CERT-EU will publish a public technical advisory/report that explicitly references the 'wiper' malware campaign targeting Poland’s energy sector (or a clearly linked IOC set) and provides mitigation guidance for European critical infrastructure, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A publicly accessible ENISA or CERT-EU publication (alert/advisory/report) names the Poland energy-grid wiper incident (or unambiguously links via malware family/IOCs) and includes recommended mitigations.
evidence: Ars Technica reports never-before-seen wiper malware targeted Poland’s energy grid: https://arstechnica.com/security/2026/01/wiper-malware-targeted-poland-energy-grid-but-failed-to-knock-out-electricity/
monitoring_signals: CERT-EU threat-intel advisories mentioning wipers/Poland/energy
ENISA incident reports on OT/ICS threats
EU-level statements about critical-infrastructure cyber incidents
predictions.rationale: A novel critical-infrastructure wiper attempt typically triggers EU-level technical sharing; publication timing is uncertain but often follows within weeks to months.

predictions.text: The U.S. SEC will formally end (dismissal, settlement, or final consent judgment) at least one high-profile enforcement action against a major U.S.-facing crypto exchange other than Gemini—specifically Coinbase, Kraken, or Binance.US—by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: SEC litigation docket shows a filed stipulation/order of dismissal or settlement fully resolving an SEC enforcement case vs Coinbase, Kraken, or Binance.US; or SEC issues a press release announcing case resolution, on/before 2026-06-30.
evidence: TechCrunch reports the SEC dropped its lawsuit against Gemini, suggesting a softer enforcement posture: https://techcrunch.com/2026/01/24/sec-drops-lawsuit-against-winklevoss-twins-gemini-crypto-exchange/
monitoring_signals: PACER/SEC litigation releases for Coinbase/Kraken/Binance.US cases
SEC enforcement press releases signaling policy shifts
Statements by exchanges about case status changes
predictions.rationale: If enforcement posture is shifting, additional case wind-downs are plausible, but complex litigation/settlement dynamics keep confidence moderate.

predictions.text: Meta will report a Reality Labs operating loss of at least $4.5 billion (USD) for a single quarter in an earnings release covering Q1 2026 or Q2 2026, by 2026-08-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Meta quarterly earnings release (or 10-Q) reports Reality Labs 'operating loss' (or equivalent segment operating income) of ≤ -$4.5B for a single quarter, with the filing/release date on/before 2026-08-15.
evidence: CNBC notes intensified cuts in Meta Reality Labs and 'VR winter' fears: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/24/metas-reality-labs-cuts-sparked-fears-of-a-vr-winter.html
monitoring_signals: Meta earnings segment reporting for Reality Labs
Disclosures of additional Reality Labs restructuring charges
VR headset shipment and pricing trends affecting RL revenue/losses
predictions.rationale: Reality Labs has a history of multi-billion quarterly losses; continued restructuring does not necessarily prevent large operating losses.

predictions.text: Berkshire Hathaway will reduce its Kraft Heinz (KHC) position by at least 50% (by number of shares) versus the position reported for the quarter ended 2025-12-31, as shown in a Berkshire Form 13F filed by 2026-11-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Compare Berkshire’s 13F for 2025-12-31 holdings (baseline) to any later 13F filed on/before 2026-11-15; prediction resolves true if reported KHC share count is at least 50% lower than baseline.
evidence: CNBC reports Berkshire’s new CEO Greg Abel signaled Kraft Heinz stake may be written down or exited: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/24/new-berkshire-ceo-abel-quickly-signals-troubled-kraft-heinz-stake-could-be-toast.html
monitoring_signals: Berkshire quarterly 13F filings and any KHC-related commentary
KHC impairment/write-down disclosures
Berkshire annual meeting Q&A regarding legacy consumer holdings
predictions.rationale: Management signaling increases odds of a meaningful trim, but Berkshire often moves slowly and may choose partial reduction or continued holding.

predictions.text: The U.S. FDA will grant a Breakthrough Device Designation to an implanted brain-computer interface (BCI) intended to restore communication and/or upper-limb motor function for people with paralysis, and the designation will be publicly disclosed by the developer, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A company/university developing an implanted BCI publicly announces receiving FDA Breakthrough Device Designation for a paralysis-related indication (communication and/or upper-limb motor restoration), with announcement date on/before 2026-12-31.
evidence: ScienceDaily highlights accelerating progress in brain-wave interfaces toward restoring movement in paralysis: https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2026/01/260124073926.htm
monitoring_signals: Company press releases from leading implanted-BCI developers
ClinicalTrials.gov postings indicating pivotal/IDE progress
FDA Breakthrough Device-related disclosures in investor updates
predictions.rationale: Momentum in neuroprosthetics makes a designation plausible, but FDA decisions and public disclosure timing are uncertain; multiple teams compete and may not disclose promptly.
